R

Racer - Class in <Unnamed>
Racer Abstract class which represents all karts driving around on the map This class handles the bulk of things that define a Racer (someone in a kart) in the game world.
Racer(double, double) - Constructor for class Racer
As well as calling the super constructor, which mainly just places the object on the map, this constructor sets the values relating to the movement of the Racer to the standard constants.
readTextDataFile(String) - Static method in interface GlobalHelper
This method returns the data section of a text file that is read in.
render(GameContainer, Graphics) - Method in class Game
Render the entire screen, so it reflects the current game state.
render(Graphics, int, Item) - Method in class Panel
Renders the status panel for the player.
render(double, double) - Method in class RenderableObject
Renders the object onto the screen based on the position of the camera viewport/position.
render(Graphics) - Method in class World
Render the entire screen, so it reflects the current game state.
RenderableObject - Class in <Unnamed>
RenderableObject Abstract class from which all other rendered objects are derived The highest level class representing objects rendered into the game world.
RenderableObject(double, double) - Constructor for class RenderableObject
Sets the most basic characteristics of a RenderableObject, namely its position and angle.
renderEnemies(Enemy[], double, double) - Static method in class Enemy
Takes the list of enemies and calls their render methods one by one, pretty simple.
renderExplicitly(double, double) - Method in class Item
Draws the Item explicitly to given coordinates on the screen.
renderItems(ArrayList<Item>, double, double) - Static method in class Item
Currently this just renders every item in the game world without consideration for if they are actually in the screen frame.
